reviewText:
Carson City Kid & Colorado

These two movies feature Roy Rogers, The King of the Cowboys, in two entertaining movies. You can find more details in each individual review.

The Carson City Kid (1940) is a story about a search for a criminal. It warns against gambling and misidentifying a suspect. This shows life in a frontier mining town.

Colorado (1940) tells how the US Secret Service sent an agent to stop Confederate activities (Army payroll robbery, selling guns to Indians). The Colorado Territory Militia commanded by General Kit Carson repelled the Confederate Armys invasion and saved the gold and silver mines.
Any Roy Rogers movie is great!  I am a real fan!  Love the old stories, western scenery and of course, the horses.
